content.description: Second bolt will be to the left on flat wall around chest level while you stand in nice (short) dihedral. Easy clipping spots, but a reach to the 4th bolt, and crux is pulling through to the anchors.
content.location: 3rd route on the wall, the first bolt can be reached from the ground on a long boulder near the start.

content.description: Starts on low angle, good holds, pull your way up midway on jugs...crux is below anchors.
content.location: The slabby Left section of Little Guide's wall. It's right of the mini-roof.

content.description: This route goes up the orange, chossy-looking roof section just to the left of Rattled. Don't let the name fool you, the choss has been eliminated for the most part due to thorough development (over a year's worth of pulling and banging on every hold.) Crux is going to depend on your strengths. There's a bit of something for everyone - endurance pumpiness, bouldery start, roof climbing, fun anchor clips. Don't pass this route up due to its appearance, it's a gem and worth doing.
content.protection: 5 bolts, one long permadraw   Sport anchors
content.location: Starts with left hand in broken-looking slot, right on chalked jug.

content.description: Start on the tombstone-shaped boulder on the deck to reach the first bolt, then dyno up and left for a good hold to then ascend the next section. Five total bolts with sport clips for anchors. Negative with big holds up tiers of roofs to the anchors on a face above the last tier.
Face climbing through two bolts to a series of ledges to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a sport clip anchor.

content.description: Easy route, could be used for a warmup if you start at this wall. Big first move to solid hold and first bolt. Probably the crux.
Starts on sharp boulder near base. Pulls into a bouldery start. Juggy middle with a nice top out. Bonus points if you can find the dual kneebar.
Starts on boulder with a low first bolt. To remove the R rating, stickclip the second bolt.
content.location: Immediately left of War on Choss.

content.description: Start on the slanting boulder on the deck to reach up to bolt 1. Start through bolt 3 is the crux to easy climbing to the anchors.

This is an extension onto "Call of the Wild Man" that adds maybe 15 feet of bouldering to get to the start. Call was such a short route and we felt this added enough moves to denote a separate route.  

  This start extends the crux on Call of the Wild man by roughly 8 hand/feet moves and has some fun V3 action.
content.protection:
4 Bolts on Call 

  Spotter or crashpad needed for starting the extension.
content.location: Typical start for Call of the Wild Man is atop the large slanted boulder on two jug ledges. Drop down into the small cave dihedral area below and sit-start with hands matching on the lowest chalked rail - feet are on nubs just above the muddy area. Work right to left up to the jugs.

content.description: A variation start of Cursed Ascent. However, after first bolt, start traversing to What a Load's first bolt and continue to traverse crossing Champain and Strawberries, PLD and finish on Bergagle's anchors. This route traverses left crossing 3 routes and finishing on a 4th line. Maybe the most fun on this section of the wall. Definitely the longest.
content.location: Start on the Cursed Ascent's slab start.

content.description: Warm up route for Little Guide's Wall. Starts on slab, follow big holds all the way up.
content.location: The slabby Left section of Little Guide's wall. It's right of the mini-roof. It's also to the right of What a Load.

content.description: The route farthest right of Little Guide's wall. Starts off really easy on a ramp...slabs over, and the crux is climbing over the rounded arete. The holds are hidden...but when you find them, your good as gold!
content.location: On the right side of Little Guide's wall, on the rounded arete. This route is off to the right side and not in the same collection as all the other routes to the left.

content.description: Really fun route, a bit soft for the grade, probably a 5.10a. Pull the mini roof to the right, and move to the crux clip at bolt 3.
content.protection: 3 or 4 bolts, 2 sport anchors at the top.

content.description:
The crux of this route starts right from the go. Side pulls and high feet make reaching up for crimp ledges a bit thuggish. Some holds are a bit sharp. Route is all but over once you've clipped bolt 3. 

  Do stop and take a peek at the little shrine near the top.
content.location: Starts on a slanted boulder on two jug ledges.

content.description: Soft for the grade, start on tufas down and right for harder, alternate start.
content.location: Just right on Bengy Bengy Fever. Has a small tree growing on a ledge about halfway up route. Starts slightly left of bolt on small, good crimp and side pull.

content.description: Suggested rating of 5.10a starting from a boulder. Start beneath the boulder and your belayer, as low as you can, for a new crux and bump to about 5.10c/d.
content.location: Just right of White Horse Mescalito. Bolt 2 is located on a mini roof.

content.description:
Little Guide's Wall has a number of routes from 5.9 to 5.11-. A few really great routes, the wall is a good warm up for Awesome Roof just down the trail. 

  Also covered in shade all day due to the trees, may vary depending on the time of year.
